ml.alternet.parser.util

Interface HasWhitespacePolicy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Grammar.CharToken, Grammar.Choice, Grammar.EnumToken, Grammar.EnumValueToken, Grammar.GrammarToken, Grammar.Number, Grammar.Skip, Grammar.StringToken, Grammar.Token, Grammar.TypedToken

    public interface HasWhitespacePolicy
    A token (or a rule) may apply a whitespace policy around its input.
    Author:
    Philippe Poulard
    See Also:
    Grammar.WhitespacePolicy

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void applyWhitespacePolicyAfter(Scanner scanner)
      Apply the whitespace policy after the token.
      default boolean applyWhitespacePolicyBefore(Scanner scanner)
      Apply the whitespace policy before the token, eventually, mark the scanner position.
      Optional<Predicate<Integer>> getWhitespacePolicy()
      Return the function that filters out whitespaces
      void setWhitespacePolicy(Optional<Predicate<Integer>> whitespacePolicy)
      Set the whitespace policy for this token.

    • Method Detail

      • setWhitespacePolicy

        void setWhitespacePolicy(Optional<Predicate<Integer>> whitespacePolicy)
        Set the whitespace policy for this token.
        Parameters:
        whitespacePolicy - Indicates whether a character is a whitespace or not.

      • getWhitespacePolicy

        Optional<Predicate<Integer>> getWhitespacePolicy()
        Return the function that filters out whitespaces
        Returns:
        The function that filters out whitespaces from a Unicode codepoint.

      • applyWhitespacePolicyBefore

        default boolean applyWhitespacePolicyBefore(Scanner scanner)
                                     throws IOException
        Apply the whitespace policy before the token, eventually, mark the scanner position.
        Parameters:
        scanner - Hold the input
        Returns:
        true if some whitespaces were trimmed, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - When an I/O exception occur.

      • applyWhitespacePolicyAfter

        default void applyWhitespacePolicyAfter(Scanner scanner)
                                 throws IOException
        Apply the whitespace policy after the token. This method is called when the token matches the input.
        Parameters:
        scanner - Hold the input
        Throws:
        IOException - When an I/O exception occur.
